snippet: The number of Americans 65 and older is expected to nearly double by the middle of the century — to 83.7 million — a trend hastened by declines in fertility and mortality rates, a Census Bureau report said.
lead_paragraph: The number of Americans 65 and older is expected to nearly double by the middle of the century — to 83.7 million — a trend hastened by declines in fertility and mortality rates, a Census Bureau report said.

headline.main: Graying of America Is Speeding, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Graying Of America Is Speeding, Report Says
